abstract: Ivy League rule blocks Cornell forward Shonn Miller from playing for team in his final year because he is a graduate student; Miller, one of the most accomplished players in program history, is still eligible to play for other schools and will essentially become a free agent in May.
lead_paragraph: An Ivy League rule forbids the participation of graduate students, so Shonn Miller, a Cornell forward, will essentially be a free agent come his graduation in May.

headline.main: Ivy Player Has Eligibility Remaining, but Not in Ivy League
headline.print_headline: Ivy Player Has Eligibility Remaining, but Not in the Ivy League
headline.seo: Shonn Miller Will Have to Leave Cornell Because of Rule on Graduate Students

snippet: An Ivy League rule forbids the participation of graduate students, so Shonn Miller, a Cornell forward, will essentially be a free agent come his graduation in May.
